definition: to sit on the ground or the floor (idiom)
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to sit/to take a seat/to take (a bus, airplane etc)/to bear fruit/variant of 座[zuo4]

sentences.english: I should sit on the floor, but I won't.
sentences.chinese: 我本應該席地而坐，但我不會這樣做。

sentences.english: We sit on the ground, looking into the distance of the wide riverbed and the night sky without stars.
sentences.chinese: 我們席地而坐，極目寬闊的河牀和沒有星月的夜空。

sentences.english: They searched for a place where they could sit on the floor.
sentences.chinese: 他們找了一個可以席地而坐的地方。

definition: to sit in a circle/seated around (a narrator)
in groups of three or four (idiom)
to sit cross-legged/to sit in the lotus position
to act as though there were nobody else present/unselfconscious/fig. without regard for others
to rest for a bit/to take a breather
